bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Alabama Photo Studios, November 21, 1941

div1.p: Hench makes arrangements to have photostats made of the book on Military Hospital No. 1.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Alabama Photo Studios, November 21, 1941

opener.dateline:
November 21, 1941 The Albama Photo Studios
Calle Obispo 314
Havana, Cuba

div1.p:
I am anxious to obtain a photostatic copy of a book in the library
of the Finlay Institute. It is “Memorias del Hospital Numero Uno” by Calliol
1903. I want it photostated completely--that is, all the context, title page,
index, maps and photographs. I understand that there are 47 pages without
maps and photographs. On the authority of Dr. Jose Rodriguez Perez, librarian
of the Finlay Institute Miss Blanca Malaret (Finlay Institute) has told me that
you can make this copy for me at a total cost of about $25.00. I enclose a
check for that amount and will adjust any differences in price that may occur.

Eventually I want a photograph of Hospital, number one, good enough
to reproduce in a book I am planning to write. I realize that your photostats of
the photographs in this book will hardly be good enough. When I receive the
photostats from you I will choose one of the photographs and ask you to make me
a photographic (not a photostatic) copy. Of course if there is only one good
photograph of the Hospital in Calliol's book please copy that one (but not the
rest of the book) by photography now rather than by photostating it and send
it with the rest.

I only want the photostatic negatives--i.e. the printing in white
and the background in black. Is your price of $25.00 for the negatives or
does that include one copy in positives? In any event please go ahead with the
order.

I am anxious to get this material as soon as I can as I am to give
a lecture on the subject here in town in about 3 weeks.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
